condition.description:
The prostate is the gland below a man's bladder that produces fluid for semen. Prostate cancer is common among older men. It is rare in men younger than 40. Risk factors for developing prostate cancer include being over 65 years of age, family history, and being African-American.

Symptoms of prostate cancer may include

  • Problems passing urine, such as pain, difficulty starting or stopping the stream, or dribbling
  • Low back pain
  • Pain with ejaculation

To diagnose prostate cancer, you doctor may do a digital rectal exam to feel the prostate for lumps or anything unusual. You may also get a blood test for prostate-specific antigen (PSA). These tests are also used in prostate cancer screening, which looks for cancer before you have symptoms. If your results are abnormal, you may need more tests, such as an ultrasound, MRI, or biopsy.

Treatment often depends on the stage of the cancer. How fast the cancer grows and how different it is from surrounding tissue helps determine the stage. Men with prostate cancer have many treatment options. The treatment that's best for one man may not be best for another. The options include watchful waiting, surgery, radiation therapy, hormone therapy, and chemotherapy. You may have a combination of treatments.

NIH: National Cancer Institute

carousel_items: Abiraterone must be taken on an empty stomach. Don't eat any food for at least 2 hours before or 1 hour after taking Abiraterone.
Don't crush or chew Abiraterone. Swallow the tablets whole with a glass of water.
Each dose of Abiraterone must be taken with a medicine called prednisone. This is to help lower the side effects you might experience with Abiraterone.

Abiraterone can cause birth defects. Men should use a condom and another form of birth control during treatment and for 1 week after. Women who are or may be pregnant shouldn't touch the tablets without gloves.
Abiraterone interacts with a lot of medicines. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting Abiraterone or any other new medicine.

basics.benefits_moa: Abiraterone is an antiandrogen. It stops tumor growth by binding to a specific enzyme in cancer cells and blocking the formation of testosterone.
basics.bottom_line: Abiraterone is an effective, first-line option for a certain type of prostate cancer, but it has many drug interactions and may be expensive.
downsides: Not the best choice if you have heart or liver problems.
Abiraterone can cause liver damage. You'll need routine blood tests to check your liver function.
There are many drug interactions.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice if you have heart or liver problems.
Abiraterone can cause liver damage. You'll need routine blood tests to check your liver function.
There are many drug interactions.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

upsides: In studies, people with a certain type of prostate cancer taking Abiraterone lived longer by about 4 months and the cancer didn't worsen by about 2 months.
In studies, people with a certain type of prostate cancer taking Abiraterone delayed starting chemotherapy by about 8 months.
Treats metastatic, castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC).
Abiraterone is an oral tablet that's taken once a day.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening liver function
risks_warnings.description: Abiraterone is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Abiraterone.

description_processed.orig: Abiraterone is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Abiraterone.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Abiraterone can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Abiraterone can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression may occur if you get an infection, are under stress, or stop taking prednisone. Tell your doctor if you notice any fatigue, dizziness, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or muscle aches.

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression may occur if you get an infection, are under stress, or stop taking prednisone. Tell your doctor if you notice any fatigue, dizziness, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or muscle aches.

risks_warnings.title: Mineralocorticoid (steroid hormone) excess
risks_warnings.description: Abiraterone may cause an increase of hormones that control salt and water balance in the body. Symptoms include high blood pressure, low potassium, and swelling. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Abiraterone.

description_processed.orig: Abiraterone may cause an increase of hormones that control salt and water balance in the body. Symptoms include high blood pressure, low potassium, and swelling. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Abiraterone.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Abiraterone may cause birth defects. Don't use Abiraterone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: You can crush the tablets and take Hydrocortisone with your food or drink. Do not open up a capsule, since they need to be swallowed whole.
Be sure not to stop taking Hydrocortisone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Some people gain weight while taking Hydrocortisone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydrocortisone is a short-acting corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation by preventing your capillaries (small blood vessels) from leaking out excess fluid and chemicals that cause swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Hydrocortisone is identical to an essential hormone that humans produce and has been proven to work safely.
downsides: In the first few weeks, your doctor might adjust the dose of Hydrocortisone multiple times.
You may be at an increased risk of infection if you take high doses of Hydrocortisone, or if you take it in combination with other immunosuppressive medications.
Your body could stop making its own cortisol once it gets used to Hydrocortisone. If so, you'll likely have to keep taking Hydrocortisone for a really long time.
Depending on why your doctor prescribed Hydrocortisone to you, corticosteroids can have different effects on your body.

downsides_processed.orig: In the first few weeks, your doctor might adjust the dose of Hydrocortisone multiple times.
You may be at an increased risk of infection if you take high doses of Hydrocortisone, or if you take it in combination with other immunosuppressive medications.
Your body could stop making its own cortisol once it gets used to Hydrocortisone. If so, you'll likely have to keep taking Hydrocortisone for a really long time.
Depending on why your doctor prescribed Hydrocortisone to you, corticosteroids can have different effects on your body.

upsides: Normal doses of hydrocortisone have been safely and successfully used for over 60 years. It's especially good for people using it as a long-term cortisol supplement.
Hydrocortisone converts into cortisol, a natural hormone, which will not interfere with other medications you may be taking.
Taking a dose of Hydrocortisone in the evening doesn't affect your ability to sleep.
At safe doses, Hydrocortisone can actually increase your body's ability to fight infection.

Be sure not to stop taking Hydrocortisone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Some people gain weight while taking Hydrocortisone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Hydrocortisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Hydrocortisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Hydrocortisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Hydrocortisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Hydrocortisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Hydrocortisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Hydrocortisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Hydrocortisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: Its rare, but taking Hydrocortisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposis sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Hydrocortisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Hydrocortisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Hydrocortisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Hydrocortisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your childs height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Hydrocortisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your childs height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Hydrocortisone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

description_processed.orig: Taking Hydrocortisone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Hydrocortisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Hydrocortisone with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

carousel_items: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

basics.benefits_moa: Dexamethasone is a short-acting corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation by preventing your capillaries (small blood vessels) from leaking out excess fluid and chemicals that cause swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Dexamethasone is identical to an essential hormone that humans produce and has been proven to work safely.
downsides: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

risks_warnings.description: Its rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposis sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. risks_warnings.title: Mood and behavior changes

basics.benefits_moa: Medrol is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Medrol is corticosteroid available in many forms (oral, injectable) that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

basics.benefits_moa: Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Ciprofloxacin is a good and cheap antibiotic to treat many types of bacterial infections. However, you have to reduce your caffeine intake, and have to protect yourself from the sun.
downsides: Must be used with caution in people over 60 years of age, or who have had either an organ transplant or on long-term steroid use due to possible tendon rupture.
If you have caffeine while on Ciprofloxacin, you may noticed increased effects of the caffeine.
Ciprofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Can't be used if you've ever had myasthenia gravis.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea

carousel_items: Take Propecia at the same time every day, with or without food.
Hang in there; it can take up to 3 months before you notice any improvement.
You might have a loss of sexual desire or arousal in the beginning.
It's normal to experience hair shedding in the first few months.
Tell your doctor if you notice an unusual rash, swelling of the mouth, tightness in the chest, or trouble breathing.
Using Nizoral shampoo with Propecia greatly helps stop hair loss.

basics.benefits_moa: Propecia is a 5 alpha-reductase inhibitor. It stops dihydrotestosterone (DHT) from shrinking your hair follicles and preventing hair growth. Without DHT, your hair can grow more normally.
basics.bottom_line: Propecia works great for crown balding, as long as you keep taking it.
downsides: Only good for the crown of the head. If you have a receding hairline, Propecia may not work.
If you stop taking it, you will lose the hair you grew while on it.
You need to have your blood tested regularly for signs of prostate cancer while taking Propecia.
Sexual side effects can continue after you stop taking Propecia.
Should never be used by women or children.

userStories.tip: Horrible toxin. Took it for 4 weeks and it destroyed my life. There are thousands of men from every corner of the globe that have been destroyed by this drug..

This drug blocks more than just DHT, it blocks the production of 6 other neurosteroids which can result in anxiety, major depression, brain fog, muscle loss, estrogen dominance and much more. This drug literally ruined my life.
sometimes I stop taking it till I notice my hair loss increase then restart it.

Start taking Propecia before you have a lot of hair loss to save what you have.  It's not a miracle drug that is going to make a bald person have a thick head of hair, but will help you to save what you have.
No obvious effect compared to Flomax, MD says it is insurance

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Propecia at the same time every day, with or without food.
Hang in there; it can take up to 3 months before you notice any improvement.
You might have a loss of sexual desire or arousal in the beginning.
It's normal to experience hair shedding in the first few months.
Tell your doctor if you notice an unusual rash, swelling of the mouth, tightness in the chest, or trouble breathing.
Using Nizoral shampoo with Propecia greatly helps stop hair loss.

risks_warnings.title: Exposure to pregnant women
risks_warnings.description: Pregnant women should never handle crushed or broken tablets of Propecia because it can cause really serious birth defects in babies.

risks_warnings.title: Effects on Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA)
risks_warnings.description: The 5mg form of Propecia is used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). In studies, the 1 mg tablet was also able to lower prostate specific antigen (PSA) levels. If PSA levels increase, men taking Propecia should be tested for prostate cancer.

carousel_items: Take Proscar once daily, about the same time each day, with or without food.
Women who can get pregnant shouldnt touch Proscar tablets.
If youre taking Proscar with doxazosin, you can take both at the same time or take the doxazosin closer to bedtime to avoid dizziness.

basics.benefits_moa: Proscar blocks the action of 5-alpha-reductase, an enzyme responsible for changing testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT). Lower DHT levels prevents the prostate from growing.
basics.bottom_line: Proscar works well for mild to moderate symptoms of BPH. When men have more severe symptoms, it can be combined with doxazosin or other medicines for added benefits.
downsides: Women who can get pregnant shouldnt handle broken tablets. Proscar tablets are coated and prevent contact with the active medicine unless they split or break.
You need to take Proscar for at least 6 months before your prostate gets small enough for symptoms to improve.
Can cause a rash, the inability to get an erection, low sex drive, and reduced amount of sperm.

Proscar can cause PSA levels to decrease to about 50% of what it was before you started the medication. This will be considered your new starting point for PSA testing and any PSA tests you have will be compared to this going forward.

upsides: It's an option for men who have symptoms of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and either dont want surgery or arent good candidates it.
In studies, Proscar improved BPH symptoms during the first year of taking it. This effect continued for another 5 years.
Men taking Proscar have less difficulty urinating and don't need BPH-related surgery as often as others.
Can be combined with doxazosin, an alpha-adrenergic antagonist, if your symptoms are more severe. Using both together can improve symptoms and improve BPH symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Effects on prostate specific antigen (PSA) and detection of prostate cancer
risks_warnings.description: Proscar causes PSA levels to decrease to about 50% of what it was before you started in the first 6 months of treatment. This will be considered your new starting point for PSA testing and any PSA tests you have will be compared to this going forward. PSA levels should be doubled to compare to normal range in men treated with Proscar. Any increase in PSA while taking Proscar may be a sign of prostate cancer and needs to be checked.

risks_warnings.title: Prostate cancer
risks_warnings.description: Compared to placebo (sugar pill), Proscar decreased the overall risk of prostate cancer but may increase the risk of high-grade prostate cancer. In a 7-year follow-up study, men age 55 and older had a higher risk of high-grade prostate cancer when taking Proscar.

description_processed.orig: Compared to placebo (sugar pill), Proscar decreased the overall risk of prostate cancer but may increase the risk of high-grade prostate cancer. In a 7-year follow-up study, men age 55 and older had a higher risk of high-grade prostate cancer when taking Proscar.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to male fetus
risks_warnings.description: Proscar may cause birth defects to a male fetus of a pregnant woman who is exposed to the medicine. Proscar crushed or broken tablets can be absorbed through the skin. The unbroken tablets are coated to prevent this. Women shouldn't be in contact with crushed or broken tablets or semen from a male partner taking Proscar.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Proscar is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Proscar is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Sexual problems
risks_warnings.description: Its not that common, but some people had sexual side effects that continued after they stopped taking Proscar for BPH.  Side effects included problems with erection and orgasm, low sex drive, and reduced amount of sperm. It was more likely to happen in older men, taking medicines that have sexual side effects, and had conditions that cause sexual problems.
